content: <!DOCTYPE MMR_DSD SYSTEM "mmr_dsd.dtd"> <MMR_DSD> <Entry_ID>EUR-L4UHRfnd-GAL-ODYSSEA</Entry_ID> <Entry_Title>Analysed L4 foundation sea surface temperature over Galapagos and Pacific Central America</Dataset_Title> <Dataset_Series_Name>Galapagos L4 Ultra-high Resolution SSTfnd (L4UHRfnd)</Dataset_Series_Name> <Dataset_Release_Date>20080114T000000Z</Dataset_Release_Date> <Dataset_Release_Place>IFREMER/CERSAT, Bretagne, France</Dataset_Release_Place> <Dataset_Publisher>Medspiration, IFREMER/CERSAT</Dataset_Publisher> <Version>1.0</Version> <Other_Citation_Details>These data are produced by the ESA Medspiration project funded by the European Space Agency Data User Element (ESA-DUE)</Other_Citation_Details> <Online_Resource>ftp://ftp.ifremer.fr</Online_Resource> </Data_Set_Citation> <Parameters> <Category>Earth Science</Category> <Topic>Oceans</Topic> <Term>Ocean Temperature</Term> <Variable>Sea Surface Temperature</Variable> <Detailed_Variable>Foundation Sea Surface Temperature (SSTfnd)</Detailed_Variable> </Parameters> <Sensor_Name> <Short_Name>AVHRR</Short_Name> <Long_Name>Advanced Very High Resolution Radiometer</Long_Name> </Sensor_Name> <Sensor_Name> <Short_Name>AMSRE</Short_Name> <Long_Name>Advanced Microwave Scanning Radiometer</Long_Name> </Sensor_Name> <Sensor_Name> <Short_Name>TMI</Short_Name> <Long_Name>Tropical rainfall measuring mission Microwave Imager</Long_Name> </Sensor_Name> <Sensor_Name> <Short_Name>AATSR</Short_Name> <Long_Name>Advanced Along-Track Scanning Radiometer</Long_Name> </Sensor_Name> <Sensor_Name> <Short_Name>SEVIRI</Short_Name> <Long_Name>Spinning Enhanced Visible and Infrared Imager</Long_Name> </Sensor_Name> <Source_Name> <Short_Name>Medspiration, IFREMER/CERSAT</Short_Name> <Long_Name>Institut Francais de Recherche pour l'Exploitation de la Mer / Centre ERS d'Archivage et de Traitement</Long_Name> </Source_Name> <Temporal_Coverage> <Start_Date>20080114T000000Z</Start_Date> </Temporal_Coverage> <Spatial_Coverage> <Southernmost_Latitude>-20.00</Southernmost_Latitude> <Northernmost_Latitude>20.00</Northernmost_Latitude> <Westernmost_Longitude>-120.00</Westernmost_Longitude> <Easternmost_Longitude>-69.00</Easternmost_Longitude> <Minimum_Altitude>0.00</Minimum_Altitude> <Maximum_Altitude>0.00</Maximum_Altitude> <Minimum_Depth>0.00</Minimum_Depth> <Maximum_Depth>0.00</Maximum_Depth> </Spatial_Coverage> <Location> <Location_Name>Galapagos and Central America</Location_Name> <Detailed_Location>Pacific ocean restricted to Central America, Galapagos and Coco Islands area</Detailed_Location> </Location> <Projection_Information> <Projection_Type>Grid</Projection_Type> <Other_Projection_Details>latitude longitude gridded analysis field</Other_Projection_Details> </Projection_Information> <Data_Resolution> <Latitude_Resolution>0.02 degree</Latitude_Resolution> <Longitude_Resolution>0.02 degree</Longitude_Resolution> <Altitude_Resolution>0.00</Altitude_Resolution> <Temporal_Resolution>Daily</Temporal_Resolution> </Data_Resolution> <Access_Constraints>None</Access_Constraints> Recherche pour l'Exploitation de la Mer, Center d'Exploitation et de Recherche Satellitaire</Long_Name> </Data_Center_Name> <Data_Center_URL>http://cersat.ifremer.fr</Data_Center_URL> <Data_Set_ID>EUR-L4UHRfnd-GAL-ODYSSEA</Data_Set_ID> <Personnel> <Role>Technical Contact</Role> <First_Name>Jean-Francois</First_Name> <Last_Name>Piolle</Last_Name> <Email>jfpiolle@ifremer.fr</Email> <Phone>+33-2-98224691</Phone> <Fax>+33-2-98224533</Fax> <Address>IFREMER CERSAT, Technopole Brest-Iroise, 29280 Plouzane, France </Address> </Personnel> <Personnel> <Role>Principal Investigator</Role> <First_Name>Emmanuelle</First_Name> <Last_Name>Autret</Last_Name> <Email>eautret@ifremer.fr</Email> <Phone>+33-2-98224532</Phone> <Fax>+33-2-98224533</Fax> <Address>IFREMER CERSAT, Technopole Brest-Iroise, 29280 Plouzane, France </Address> </Personnel> </Data_Center> <Reference>MERSEA-WP02-IFR-STR-001-1A, J. F. Piolle,E. Autret, Septembre 2007</Reference> <Summary>The ODYSSEA Galapagos and Pacific Central America Sea Surface Temperature is produced at Ifremer/CERSAT. It provides a daily cloud-free field of foundation sea surface temperature at 2 km resolution (0.02 degree). It is generated by merging all available satellite sensors for sea surface temperature (micro-wave and infra-red), after careful intercalibration using AATSR sensor as reference (previously re-calibrated using all available in situ data). The development of this real-time sea surface temperature at Ifremer/CERSAT is supported by ESA initially in the frame of Medspiration project. </Summary> <Related_URL> <URL_Content_Type>Project Home Page</URL_Content_Type> <URL>http://www.medspiration.org</URL> <Description>Description of the Medspiration project</Description> </Related_URL> <Related_URL> <URL_Content_Type>Data access (OpenDAP)</URL_Content_Type> <URL>ftp://ftp.ifremer.fr/ifremer/medspiration/data/l4uhrsstfnd/eurdac/gal</URL> <Description>FTP Archive of the product. Access is anonymous and all archive is available online.</Description> </Related_URL> <Related_URL> <URL_Content_Type>Data access (FTP)</URL_Content_Type> <URL>http://www.ifremer.fr/cgi-bin/nph-dods/data/satellite/medspiration/l4uhrsstfnd/eurdac/gal</URL> <Description>Access to the data through OpenDAP protocol</Description> </Related_URL> <DSD_File_Version>1.0</DSD_File_Version> <DSD_Creation_Date>20080127T000000Z</DSD_Creation_Date> <DSD_Last_Revision_Date>20080127T000000Z</DSD_Last_Revision_Date> <DSD_Revision_History> 2008-01-27 J.F.Piolle: Original; </DSD_Revision_History> </MMR_DSD>
